title: Ron Johnson
added: Johnson was replaced as Chairman of the Homeland Security committee after January 26, 2021 because the Democrats won control of the Senate in the [[2020 United States Senate elections|November 2020 elections]]. He was replaced by [[Alejandro Mayorkas]].<ref name="cgam">{{cite news |last1=Gilbert |first1=Craig |title=Republican Ron Johnson presides for the last time as Senate homeland security chair |url=https://www.jsonline.com/story/news/politics/2021/01/26/ron-johnson-presides-last-time-homeland-security-chair/4261302001/ |publisher=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |date=26 January 2021}}</ref>

title: Ron Johnson
added: Johnson was replaced as Chairman of the Homeland Security committee after January 26, 2021 because the Democrats won control of the Senate in the [[2020 United States Senate elections|November 2020 elections]].The committee's last actwastoapprove[[Alejandro Mayorkas]]as Secretary.<ref name="cgam">{{cite news |last1=Gilbert |first1=Craig |title=Republican Ron Johnson presides for the last time as Senate homeland security chair |url=https://www.jsonline.com/story/news/politics/2021/01/26/ron-johnson-presides-last-time-homeland-security-chair/4261302001/ |publisher=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |date=26 January 2021}}</ref>

title: Ron Johnson
added: Johnson was replaced as Chairman of the Homeland Security committee after January 26, 2021 because the Democrats won control of the Senate in the [[2020 United States Senate elections|November 2020 elections]]and "because the [[GOP]] imposes a six-year term limit on committee chairs... no matter which party (controls) the Senate". The committee's last act was to approve [[Alejandro Mayorkas]] as Secretary.<ref name="cgam">{{cite news |last1=Gilbert |first1=Craig |title=Republican Ron Johnson presides for the last time as Senate homeland security chair |url=https://www.jsonline.com/story/news/politics/2021/01/26/ron-johnson-presides-last-time-homeland-security-chair/4261302001/ |publisher=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |date=26 January 2021}}</ref>

title: Ron Johnson
added: Johnson was replaced as Chairman of the Homeland Security committee after January 26, 2021 because the Democrats won control of the Senate in the [[2020 United States Senate elections|November 2020 elections]] and "because the [[GOP]] imposes a six-year term limit on committee chairs... no matter which party (controls) the Senate". The committee's last act was to approve [[Alejandro Mayorkas]] as Secretary. Johnson was replaced as Chairman by Michigan Democrat [[Gary Peters]].<ref name="cgam">{{cite news |last1=Gilbert |first1=Craig |title=Republican Ron Johnson presides for the last time as Senate homeland security chair |url=https://www.jsonline.com/story/news/politics/2021/01/26/ron-johnson-presides-last-time-homeland-security-chair/4261302001/ |publisher=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |date=26 January 2021}}</ref>

title: Ron Johnson
added: During the [[presidency of Barack Obama]], Johnson was known a staunch fiscal hawk who called for federal spending cuts and warned against deficits. During the [[Presidency of Donald Trump|Donald Trump administration]], Johnson defended deficit-increasing tax cuts, falsely claiming that they reduced the deficit. A staunch ally of Donald Trump, Johnson launched investigations in Trump's political opponents, spread conspiracy theories about the FBI, promoted false claims of fraud in the 2020 election, and suggested that Nancy Pelosi was at fault for the storming of the U.S. Capitol by a pro-Trump mob.

Johnson [[Climate change denial|rejects]] the [[Scientific consensus on climate change|scientific consensus]] on [[climate change]], arguing that scientists who attribute global warming to human activity are "crazy" and the theory is "lunacy." He opposes [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act|Affordable Care Act]] and has voted multiple times to repeal it. During the COVID-19 pandemic, he argued against public health measures and used his chairmanship of the Senate Homeland Security Committee to invite witnesses to push [[Misinformation related to the COVID-19 pandemic|fringe theories about COVID-19]].<ref name=":52">{{Cite news|last=Qiu|first=Linda|date=2020-12-17|title=The election is over, but Ron Johnson keeps promoting false claims of fraud.|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/16/technology/the-election-is-over-but-ron-johnson-keeps-promoting-false-claims-of-fraud.html|access-date=2020-12-18|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210101110135/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/16/technology/the-election-is-over-but-ron-johnson-keeps-promoting-false-claims-of-fraud.html|archive-date=1 January 2021|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>

title: Ron Johnson
added: Johnson [[Climate change denial|rejects]] the [[Scientific consensus on climate change|scientific consensus]] on [[climate change]], claiming that scientists who attribute global warming to human activity are "crazy" and the theory is "lunacy". He opposes [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act|Affordable Care Act]] and has voted multiple times to repeal it. During the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], he argued against public health measures and used his chairmanship of the Senate Homeland Security Committee to invite witnesses to push [[Misinformation related to the COVID-19 pandemic|fringe theories about COVID-19]].
